Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of Postia Multi-gene phylogeny and
taxonomy of the brown-rot fungus: Postia (Polyporales, Basidiomycota)
and its related genera
Keywords:
Fomitopsidaceae, Multi-marker analyses, Oligoporus,
Phylogeny, Taxonomy, Tyromyces, Wood-inhabiting fungi
Abstract:
Phylogenetic and taxonomic studies on the brown-rot fungi,
Postia and its related genera, are carried out. Based on multiple loci
DNA sequences including the internal transcribed spacer regions (ITS),
the large subunit (nLSU) and the small subunit (nSSU) of nuclear
ribosomal RNA gene, the small subunit of mitochondrial rRNA gene
(mtSSU), the translation elongation factor 1-Î± gene (TEF1), the largest
subunit of RNA polymerase II (RPB1) and the second subunit of RNA
polymerase II (RPB2), our phylogeny recognizes ten distinct clades of
Postia sensu lato. Four new genera, Amaropostia, Calcipostia,
Cystidiopostia and Fuscopostia, are established, nine new species,
Amaropostia hainanensis, Cyanosporus fusiformis, C. microporus, C.
mongolicus, C. piceicola, C. subhirsutus, C. tricolor, C. ungulatus and
Postia sublowei, are identified. Illustrated descriptions of the new
genera and species are presenteded. Identification keys to Postia and
its related genera, as well as keys to the species of each genus are
provided.
